trigger_event: Three days after leaked documents confirmed the BCI's splintering, rumors surface that vanished citizens ('the disappeared') are alive and seeking to return—with insider knowledge and BCI codes powerful enough to either reunify or irreparably fracture the city.
dilemma: Sven Halek must decide: Should he bring the disappeared citizens and their secret codes into the public eye, risking chaos but possibly restoring unity? Or, should he steer the unrest toward launching the Consensus Engine, letting citizens' collective will reshape the city—but at the cost of abandoning traditional control?
reason: Sven is torn because both choices have irreversible consequences—exposing the disappeared risks further instability and blame upon the Directorate, while unleashing the Consensus Engine invites unpredictable and uncontrollable shifts in power. Alex, the bartender, urges Sven to face the cost of hard truths versus comfortable illusions, deepening Sven's sense of responsibility.
choice_a: Authorize the public return of the disappeared and their codes, forcing the city to confront its buried secrets in hope of forging a new, hard-won unity.
belief_a: Unity requires confronting uncomfortable truths head-on.
Legitimacy comes from transparency, even when painful.
Control can be regained by orchestrating the story, not hiding it.
choice_b: Channel unrest into launching the Consensus Engine, letting each zone vote on rules and priorities, and surrendering the dream of a single city identity.
belief_b: Fragmentation is better than a return to false unity.
Empowering citizen voices will bring stability through honest diversity.
Real control is found in setting the terms of a new experiment, not clinging to the past.
